definition: to brandish (a figurative weapon, i.e. some measure intended to deal with the situation)/to resort to (some tactic)
surname Zhai
to offer a sacrifice to (gods or ancestors)/memorial ceremony/(in classical novels) to recite an incantation to activate a magic weapon/(lit. and fig.) to wield

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc

sentences.english: Miami ran plays and the Mavs played defense.
sentences.chinese: 熱火打出了配合，而小牛祭出了防守。

sentences.english: Some are raising the specter of eugenics.
sentences.chinese: 一些人還祭出了優生學的幽靈。

definition: Buddha's teaching/Buddhist monk's apparel, staff etc/(Daoism) magic weapon/talisman/fig. specially effective device/magic wand
to suddenly reveal/to flash (one's ID, a banknote etc)
(fig.) trump card
to use/to exert
to use fully/to put to use
to let off/to give out
to make a move (in martial arts or figuratively)
shield/(currency) Vietnamese dong/currency unit of several countries (Indonesian rupiah, Dutch gulden etc)
to rise in revolt/to raise difficult questions
to show results/effective
to resist/to hold back/to stop/to ward off/to withstand
to take up a challenge/to face an attack and meet it
to arrange/to lay out
trident
unique skill/unexpected tricky move (as a last resort)/masterstroke/finishing blow
to attack violently/to storm
